Lacklustre Leeds no match for UYWAFC

The score-line would suggest that the match was somewhat of a close encounter, but it was all one-way traffic as York's women's firsts football side brushed aside Leeds with ease on 22 Acres.

Women's squash team thump dire Northumbria

The women's firsts put on an incredible display of virtuoso squash to thrash Northumbria 3-0 this afternoon in under an hour

Men's rowers impress at British Championships

The University of York Boat Club Men's squad competed in their first race of the season at the British Championships last weekend, finishing ninth overall

The University of York Swimming and Water Polo Club opened the season with a friendly gala at the York Sport Village on Saturday evening

Bringing a marathon to York is brilliant, something every city deserves to experience, and I would encourage every student here to get out and enjoy it while you have the opportunity

After spending a week watching the York Hornets in action Beth Jakubowski speaks to their President, Hannah Denham, about the intensity of cheerleading and their national championship winning season

New club sponsorship deal for college sport

College sport officers Dave Washington and Tom Merriman have announced a new sponsorship deal with York Parties to increase the financial position of college sport

Vanbrugh coast past postgrads

Vanbrugh eased past a notably lethargic Wentworth side on Sunday at 22 Acres, with a brace from Elliot Rous-Ross and a fine solo effort from Clemens Blasius sealing a deserved 3-0 victory

Four-goal James hold off spirited Halifax side

James saw off a valiant second half comeback from College Cup holders Halifax to bag their second win of the autumn season on Sunday

Goodricke take victory in Hes East Derby

In a game interrupted by helicopters, pitch changes and injuries, Goodricke came out as the clear victors after thrashing their campus rivals with a seven-goal deficit on a sun-drenched 22 Acres

Derwent destroy dire Alcuin

Derwent bounced back from their surprise defeat to Goodricke on Matchday One with the emphatic double-digit destruction of a slightly depleted Alcuin, 10-0

Football teams appeal points deductions after YUSU error

An appeal has been launched after all five of the University's football teams in BUCS leagues were deducted points

Five star UYAFC make perfect start

The men's firsts football team hit the ground running in their first BUCS fixture of the new season, effortlessly brushing aside Sunderland team 5-0 in pouring conditions on the 3G

Women's football earn hard-fought draw

The women's firsts football side kicked off their BUCS season with a convincing 2-2 draw against Leeds Met Carnegie in wet conditions on 22 Acres

Gritty York battle past Northumbria

A determined, gritty performance from York's women's volleyballers saw them beat their Northumbria opponents three sets to one in their opening fixture of the season

Barrett on fire as York destroy Newcastle

Katie Barrett was on form as York's women's firsts dominated Newcastle Thirds 25-0 in the opening fixture of the season.

Ideal start for men's badminton firsts

The first competitive fixture of the season saw a clinical men's badminton team dominate proceedings in the sports hall this afternoon, crushing Leeds University with a 7-1 victory.

For the second successive week, UYRUFC's first XV were narrowly beaten as they adjust to life in the BUCS Premier Division B

Youthful volleyball firsts fall to defeat in opening BUCS fixture

A young men's volleyball first team succumbed to a 3-0 home defeat at the hands of Newcastle in their first match of the season despite showing flashes of potential

UYBC men's squad to open season with National Championships

The University of York Boat Club's senior men's squad will compete in their first race of the academic year at one of the biggest competitions in the calendar this weekend

Gritty Goodricke stun Derwent with victory

Goodricke got their Autumn Term campaign off to the best possible start with a scrappy 3-2 victory over Derwent on Sunday

James edge resilient Langwith

James overcame a resilient Langwith side on a damp 22 Acres this afternoon in a 3-1 victory, despite both teams being level for most of the first half as Langwith made the most of their few chances

Slick Halifax breeze past Vanbrugh

Reigning College Cup champions Halifax got their Autumn Term campaign off to the perfect start, with a dominant 3-0 win over Vanbrugh this morning

Preparing to Win

Robert Culshaw speaks to RFL performance director Jon Roberts about the England team's journey towards the upcoming World Cup

After Sebastian Vettel claimed yet another race win in Korea, Aaron Stennett assesses where F1 stands as a whole with more technical changes to come next season

Tom Fennelly weighs in on the ongoing debate surrounding Spurs' fans use of supposedly offensive language in their chants

Keep the Faith

Beginning a 'Faith in Sport' series, George Barrett speaks to Linvoy Primus about his Christian beliefs

Get stuck in

Another summer of glorious sporting tradition has once against disappeared with deceptive speed. The Ashes were regained, a Lions tour was won and the Tour de France marked its 100th birthday with prestige. Once again, we find ourselves ready to embark on another year of sport at York, and it promises to be a special one
